perturbation.original_text: Horst Entertainment agrees to pay Galactcomm $0.01 (one cent) per access up to 400,000 accesses thereafter payment shall be $0.005 (one-half cent) per access. Horst Entertainment shall send this amount to Galacticomm by no later than Wednesday for accesses used from the previuos week (Monday thru Sunday).
perturbation.changed_text: Horst Entertainment agrees to pay Galactcomm a fee per access as outlined in Exhibit A. Horst Entertainment shall send this amount to Galacticomm by no later than Wednesday for accesses used from the previuos week (Monday thru Sunday).
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific payment amounts and referring to 'Exhibit A' without providing the exhibit, the contract creates ambiguity. If no Exhibit A exists, this introduces an internal contradiction, as the method of payment is referenced but undefined.

perturbation.original_text: Galacticomm must provide a person(s) to correct any technical problems (Server being down or inaccessible) 24 hours per day, 7 days per week. This person(s) must be available by beeper or telephone. Horst Entertainment shall provide this same 24 hour service at the broadcast location.
perturbation.changed_text: Galacticomm must provide support to correct any technical problems. Horst Entertainment shall provide service at the broadcast location as determined by mutually agreed upon service level agreements.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the '24 hours per day, 7 days per week' and beeper/telephone availability introduces ambiguity regarding the level of support. Furthermore stating 'as determined by mutually agreed upon service level agreements' while lacking said agreements introduces an omission which may not be fulfilled, creating an internal contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: In the event Galacticomm, Inc. chooses to terminate this agreement, Horst Entertainment Inc. will have the right to purchase a license copy of the software in the amount of $15,000.00.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event Galacticomm, Inc. chooses to terminate this agreement, Horst Entertainment Inc. will have the option to purchase a license copy of the software at a fair market value.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specified purchase price of $15,000.00 and instead referencing 'fair market value,' without defining how this value is to be determined, the contract introduces ambiguity. If a later disagreement arises about 'fair market value', this creates an internal contradiction.
